comments:
Im getting the following crash when I try to launch an Ant script and one of my user properties is an empty string. 

For example, 

AntLaunchDelegate.appendProperty(..., "myName", "")

Here's the offending line of code...

if (value.charAt(value.length() - 1) == File.separatorChar) {
    commandLine.append(File.separatorChar);
}

This was not an issue with 3.1.


The stack dump...

I made a bandaid to make sure if I have an empty string property value to change it to a string with a space to get around this bug. 

For example, 
AntLaunchDelegate.appendProperty(..., "myName", " ")

Thank you for the bug report.
Reducing severity as a workaround exists.
Investigate fix for RC2.
Introduced regression from fix for bug 102641 not considering empty string values.
